Issues.Title: Allow customization of Hydration's HTTP Cache Transfer
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

common

### Description

One of the most interesting features of Angular's hydration is HTTP Cache Transfer which currently caches responses of all GET/HEAD HTTP requests.
The current limitation is that there doesn't seem any built-in way of overriding the [behavior](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/47c093a7391e550bfb01cff57a6fc712f3342d14/packages/common/http/src/transfer_cache.ts#L35) except using the `withNoHttpTransferCache()` feature when calling `provideClientHydration()` in order to totally disable the feature.

It would be nice if we could override this behavior for the following use cases:
- A. caching other HTTP methods _(e.g. "Safe" use of POST for batching or sending large query strings, maybe even GraphQL which would probably need its own custom transfer)_ and in that case the key computation will also be different.
- B. disabling the cache transfer for some specific requests or origins:
  - B.0. state transfer is handled manually _(e.g. in order to reduce the amount of transferred data as the HTTP response can be way larger than the data really needed)_
  - B.1. private network or internal APIs but publicly hosted SSR
  - B.2. device-specific response (e.g. tracking & debugging... get my IP address... (then it shouldn't be a GET request 😉) )
  - B.3. emit cached response + new request (e.g. in SSG cases, we might want to fetch fresh data in case SSG-ed is not up-to-date).

### Proposed solution

IMO, not all of these use cases should be handled by Angular's hydration's HTTP cache transfer.

Allowing per-request opt-out would be enough to let developers customize the behavior for unconventional requests using `TransferState`.

This could be done globally using a feature:
```ts
provideClientHydration(withHttpTransferCache({filter: req => !req.url.startsWith('https://internal')}));
```

and per request
```ts
http.get('/my-ip-address', {cacheTransfer: false}); // we'll have to figure out a better naming for this
```

### Alternatives considered

Disable the feature using `withNoHttpTransferCache()` and implement our own transfer logic like before using `TransferState`.

Right now, we can easily mimic the current behavior which is here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/47c093a7391e550bfb01cff57a6fc712f3342d14/packages/common/http/src/transfer_cache.ts#L35-L90

The modularity of the current design (thanks to the `TransferState` primitive) and the workaround described here is sufficient enough to reduce the priority of this issue drastically...

👉 ... making it an interesting opportunity for a community initiative 😉😉 👈
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow customization of Hydration's HTTP Cache Transfer " (#50117)

Issues.Title: ready-made sample project in StackBlitz: Failed to run start command
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Angular - Docs - Getting Started - Try it - Getting Started - Create the sample project - [ready-made sample project in StackBlitz](https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/getting-started-v0/stackblitz.html)

After loading the page, it showed "**Failed to run start command"** with  a following error:
`~/projects/dztar2--run
❯ ng update
Unknown error: Error [ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]: require() of ES Module /home/projects/dztar2--run/node_modules/cliui/node_modules/string-width/index.js from /home/projects/dztar2--run/node_modules/cliui/build/index.cjs not supported.
Instead change the require of index.js in /home/projects/dztar2--run/node_modules/cliui/build/index.cjs to a dynamic import() which is available in all CommonJS modules.`

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/run?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Browser: Firefox Web Brower 112.0.1 (64-bit), and Google Chrome Version 112.0.5615.165 (Official Build) (64-bit)
OS: Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS (64-bit)
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: `toSignal()` can not be called inside `computed()`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

`toSignal()` can not set internal state ([`state.set()`](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/core/rxjs-interop/src/to_signal.ts#L177) when called from `computed()`, because of NG0600 ("Writing to signals is not allowed in a `computed` or an `effect` by default").

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hjphb7?devToolsHeight=33&file=src/main.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
ERROR
Error: NG0601: `toSignal()` called with `requireSync` but `Observable` did not emit synchronously.

ERROR
Error: NG0600: Writing to signals is not allowed in a `computed` or an `effect` by default. Use `allowSignalWrites` in the `CreateEffectOptions` to enable this inside effects.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
@angular/core 16.0.0-rc.4
```


### Anything else?

It is reproducible without Component's template, so the issue is not caused by the template: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rbp4uq?devToolsHeight=33&file=src/main.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`toSignal()` can not be called inside `computed()`" (#50106)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): introduce internal transplanted type
Issues.Body: Adds a new AST for a `TransplantedType` in the compiler which will be used for some upcoming work. A transplanted type is a type node that is defined in one place in the app, but needs to be copied to a different one (e.g. the generated .d.ts). These changes also include updates to the type translator that will rewrite any type references within the type to point to the new context file.

Issues.Title: build: update dependency jsdom to v22
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [jsdom](https://togithub.com/jsdom/jsdom) | devDependencies | major | [`^21.0.0` -> `^22.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/jsdom/21.1.0/22.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>jsdom/jsdom</summary>

### [`v22.0.0`](https://togithub.com/jsdom/jsdom/blob/HEAD/Changelog.md#​2200)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/jsdom/jsdom/compare/21.1.2...22.0.0)

-   Node.js v16 is now the minimum supported version.
-   Removed support for running jsdom in the browser via a [browserified](https://browserify.org/) bundle. This carried with it too much complexity, especially for our testing infrastructure, and [a testing package we relied on was recently deprecated](https://togithub.com/karma-runner/karma#karma-is-deprecated-and-is-not-accepting-new-features-or-general-bug-fixes).

### [`v21.1.2`](https://togithub.com/jsdom/jsdom/blob/HEAD/Changelog.md#​2112)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/jsdom/jsdom/compare/21.1.1...21.1.2)

-   Fixed `setRangeText()` used on `<input>` and `<textarea>` elements to calculate the new end index correctly. (pmstss)
-   Fixed `pageX`, `pageY`, `offsetX`, and `offsetY` on `MouseEvent`s during dispatch. (jenseng)
-   Upgraded `nwsapi` to v2.2.4, bringing along various fixes to our selector engine.

### [`v21.1.1`](https://togithub.com/jsdom/jsdom/blob/HEAD/Changelog.md#​2111)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/jsdom/jsdom/compare/21.1.0...21.1.1)

-   Fixed `jsdom.reconfigure()` to also adjust the URL as seen by the history API, so that e.g. `history.replaceState(null, "")` would not mess up the URL. (jdufresne)
-   Fixed `location.hash = ""` to leave any `#` in location.href.
-   Fixes a few bugs with CSS parsing by replacing `cssom` with `rweb-cssom`, since the latter is maintained. (seanparmelee)

</details>

---

Issues.Title: Docs : "See also" links are not always links.
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

The API documention is very inconsistant about the handling of the "See also" sections. 

This is handled by the `@see` jsdoc tag. 

In the codebase we have several usages with different results : 

1. 
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1bc3546c7f99466d3ac57bf06cacb3dc645c0f48/packages/common/http/src/provider.ts#L58-L63

Here the code a navigable in IDEs but not in [the documentation](https://v15.angular.io/api/common/http/provideHttpClient). 

2.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1bc3546c7f99466d3ac57bf06cacb3dc645c0f48/packages/core/src/metadata/di.ts#L78-L81

Here the code is not navigable in IDEs but is in [the documentation](https://v15.angular.io/api/core/Query#see-also).

3.
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1bc3546c7f99466d3ac57bf06cacb3dc645c0f48/packages/core/src/change_detection/constants.ts#L14
Here the code is navigable in both IDEs and [the documentation](https://v15.angular.io/api/core/ChangeDetectionStrategy)

----

I propose we migrate step by step the inline documentation to using `@link` to ensure code and online documentation stay navigable. 

This issue will be used to link the several PRs that improve that topic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Docs : "See also" links are not always links. " (#50097)

Issues.Title: feat(http): allow `XhrFactory.build` to be an async function
Issues.Body:
This commit updates the `@angular/common/http` package to allow the `XhrFactory.build` function to be async.

This support is needed to provide an ability to do a dynamic import in case an implementation of the `XmlHttpRequest` requires an extra library (which is the case for Node, Angular uses `xhr2` library).

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid hash filenames for non-injected global styles/scripts
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, non-injected global styles and scripts were unintentionally being output with filenames that contain a hash. This can prevent the filenames from being discoverable and therefore usable at runtime. The output filenames will now no longer contain a hash component which matches the behavior of the Webpack-based builder.

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

1.  Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2.  Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "1.31.0")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "800c49c2a3d3dfe8d17e4f6ec05db195b4eee7f2b098f20f67023d883b587306",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-1.31.0",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/releases/download/v1.31.0/bazel-lib-v1.31.0.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

```

Optional toolchains:

```starlark

### Register the following toolchain to use jq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_jq_toolchains")

register_jq_toolchains()

### Register the following toolchain to use yq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_yq_toolchains")

register_yq_toolchains()
```

Issues.Title: WIP for internal g3 testing only - see #26028 for full PR
Issues.Body:
Swap out the current logic for determining when to resize the outline
gap, for logic based on ResizeObserver. The current logic tries to guess
when the size may need to change based on observing the content,
checking after fonts load, etc. But using ResizeObserver should catch
more cases.

Also brings the gap calculation logic outside the NgZone to avoid
running unnecessary change detections.

Issues.Title: bug(MatSlideToggle): Use primary, accent and warn colors of palette instead of 300,600,200 and 900
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

To use the colors property on the [mat-slide-toggle](https://material.angular.io/components/slide-toggle/overview) the developer has to define explicitely the color values of `300`, `600`, `200` and `900` in the `$color-palette`, otherwise the fallback values will be used.

All other components i have seen use the `primary`, `accent` or `warn` values on the palette to work in conjunction with the `color` property (e.G. `mat-radio-button`) except this one.

The scss file in question is this one 
[src/material/slide-toggle/_slide-toggle-theme.scss](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/slide-toggle/_slide-toggle-theme.scss#L50)

Here is an example for the radio button to get the correct colors:
[src/material/radio/_radio-theme.scss](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/radio/_radio-theme.scss#L12)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Define color palette not using the `300`, `600`, `200` and `900` keys as hues
```scss
$primary-palette: (
   default:  #9F9F9F,
   lighter:  #E8E8E8,
   darker: #262626
)

$my-theme: mat.define-light-theme(
   color: (
      primary: mat.define-palette($primary-palette, default, lighter, darker)
   )
)

...
```
3. Use `<mat-slide-toggle color="primary">`



### Expected Behavior

Color of component should be `#9F9F9F`

### Actual Behavior

Color of toggle is `#6200ee` (fallback)

### Environment

Issues.Title: bug(MatIconHarness): MatIconHarness for MatIcon with MatBadge returns wrong name
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using MatIconHarness.getName() I would expect to get the name of the icon.
I have the following MatIcon inside a IconButton:
``` html
<mat-icon
    [matBadgeHidden]="notifications.length === 0"
    [matBadge]="notifications.length"
    matBadgeColor="accent"
    matBadgeOverlap="false"
    matBadgePosition="above after"
  >
    {{ notifications.length === 0 ? 'notifications' : 'notifications_active' }}
  </mat-icon>
```

In my tests I get the following result:
``` js
test('should have correct icon', async () => {
    const matIcon = await toggleBtn.getHarness(MatIconHarness);
    expect(await matIcon.getName()).toBe('notifications_active');
})
```

The test fails because getName returns: "notifications_active 2"
2 is the size of the notifications or the MatBadge.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a MatIcon with a MatBadge.
2. Create a Component Test with the MatIconHarness and check the name of the icon.


### Expected Behavior

Should return the name of the MatIcon, without the content of the badge.

### Actual Behavior

getName() returns the name of the MatIcon and the content of the badge.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.5
- CDK/Material: 15.2.5
- Browser(s): Jest/JSDom
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): OpenSuse Tumbleweed
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatIconHarness): MatIconHarness for MatIcon with MatBadge returns wrong name" (#27015)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-menu-item): iconPositionEnd and matButtonIcon is not available for mat-menu-item
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.x

### Description

Since there was a change in mat-menu-item, that all icons are moved to the start, it is not possible anymore to place icons after the label. This breaks our current design (we have icons in front and after the label)

v15: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/15.2.x/src/material/menu/menu-item.html  
v14: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/14.2.x/src/material/menu/menu-item.html

The solution would be to also support `iconPositionEnd` for mat-menu-items as it was done for mat-button.  
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/15.2.x/src/material/button/button.html#L11

`matButtonIcon` should be supported as well.

_Bonus_: It would probably be even better to _not_ pull the icons automatically to a certain position (like it was before) or to have an additional attribute, so that an icon is not effected by the pulling (e.g. `iconPositionInline` --> `<mat-icon iconPositionInline>...</mat-icon>`). I am not sure, if this is possible with the new mdc and the change happened in the first place, because the new css-class effected the icons. Nevertheless, iconPositionEnd should be possible.

Thank you!
~Manuel

### Reproduction

```
<button mat-menu-item>
   <mat-icon>settings</mat-icon>
   Settings
   <mat-icon>open_in_new</mat-icon>
</button>
```

### Expected Behavior

It should be possible to have buttons at the start and at the end (or inline).

### Actual Behavior

Both/all icons are in the start.

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): all
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-menu-item): iconPositionEnd and matButtonIcon is not available for mat-menu-item" (#27006)

Issues.Title: Clean up e2e tests
Issues.Body:
Cleans up our e2e tests. Split up in the following commits:

#### test(multiple): remove unnecessary e2e tests
As discussed, these changes remove the e2e tests that were testing the same functionality as the unit tests. These tests didn't help us to catch any additional issues and were increasing our maintenance cost. I've left in a few tests that make sense to run as e2e (e.g. virtual scrolling and scroll blocking). I've also removed some shared utilities that either weren't used or had one call site left.


#### build: convert e2e app to standalone
Converts the e2e app to standalone APIs to reduce the amout of code we need to maintain.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Clean up e2e tests" (#27001)

Issues.Title: MDC migration: <mat-card> is migrated to appearance=outlined, which is not the MDC standard
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

According to https://m2.material.io/components/cards#anatomy, and https://material-components.github.io/material-components-web-catalog/#/component/card, the standard for cards seems to be "raised". Also, `<mat-card>` without an `appearance` attribute defaults to `raised`.

However, MDC migration for angular V15 always changes `<mat-card>` to `<mat-card appearance='outlined` /> (see https://github.com/angular/components/pull/24566/files#diff-b75b20ff5d2952053d36ef0a202e088d8533fb2e45be536f37973d923cdb0482). 

Why is that? I didn't find any documentation what's the reasoning for this. Shouldn't Angular material match the Material Design Guidelines as close as possible?

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. write an angular component which uses `<mat-card>` in Angular V14
2. migrate to Angular V15 material design according to https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/guides/v15-mdc-migration.md#how-to-migrate


### Expected Behavior

`<mat-card>` remains the same, without any additional appearance (so takes the default `raised` appearance)

### Actual Behavior

`<mat-card>` now becomes `<mat-card appearance='outlined`>`

### Environment

Angular CLI: 15.2.6
Node: 18.15.0
Package Manager: pnpm 7.29.1
OS: win32 x64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MDC migration: <mat-card> is migrated to appearance=outlined, which is not the MDC standard" (#27004)

Issues.Title: Mat-Select is not functioning properly after angular and material version upgrade from v10 to v15.2.4
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was Angular V10.1.5 and Material V10.2.4 ### Description This report is regarding dropdown field issue of Angular Material V15.2.4 (Mat-Select) Recently, we have upgraded our project's angular version from v10.1.5 to v15.2.4. Application's drop down fields were working fine in angular v10.1.5 and material v10.2.4. But when the version got upgraded with angular v15.2.4 and material v15.2.4., all the drop down fields are facing issue in showing the selected option. **Issue**: - There is no issue in listing the options. - After selecting any one of the option, mat-select has to show up the selected option. - But the field is blank after selecting an option. **Version and Coding strategy**: 1. Reactive Form is used. FormBuilder and FormGroup was used to create formcontrols. 2. After upgrade, All material imports was updated to legacy option. (Example - MatButtonLegacy) 3. In angular v10, Two-way data binding ([(ngModel)]) has been used to bind the id of the selected option, it worked fine. 4. But in v15 we have tried by removing the ngModel, still not fixed. 5. Have tired with [(value)] way of binding, that too didn't give a hand. 6. This is not a multiple select. 7. We have used exact code mentioned below in angular v10 and its not working in angular v15. Find the sample example here - https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples#select-form **Support Needed** 1. Angular support team to provide a solution to fix the issue in Mat-Select drop down. 2. To provide if any code changes or import level changes has to be done. 3. We have tested with angular v15.2.4 and material version as v12.2.13, all seems fine. 4. Is it fine to have a downgraded material version with higher angular version?. 5. **Kindly respond whether it is a good standard to have Angular v15.2.4 and material v12.2.13 as part of production release or provide an fix for the issue in the upgraded versions for both angular and material v15.2.4.** Kindly refer the below attachment which shows actual issue in the dropdown after selecting an option, the field is blank; ### Reproduction Steps to reproduce: 1. Set the angular version as 15.2.4 and material version as 15.2.4 2. Inject a Mat-Select drop down field in template 3. Set a list of options in .ts file for Mat-options (Example - Apple, Orange, Mango etc) 7. Options will be binding correctly in the selectable drop down. 8. Select any one of the values from the drop down list. 9. Issue - After selecting, selected value will not show up in the field. ### Expected Behavior The expected behavior is - After selecting any one of the option, mat-select has to show up the selected option. Expected working one as mentioned in this example - https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples#select-form ### Actual Behavior Actual behavior - After selecting an option, selected value does not show up in the Mat-Select Field. Below one the case where the field is empty after selecting an option. ### Environment - Angular: **v15.2.4** - CDK/Material: **CDK - v15.2.4 and Material - v15.2.4** - Browser(s): **Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge** - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): **Windows**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Select is not functioning properly after angular and material version upgrade from v10 to v15.2.4" (#27003)

Issues.Title: feat(all components): Test id attributes for internal elements
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

The v15 mdc merge has just butchered our e2e suite.

There are no known safe mechanisms to target material component internals e.g. a selected pseudo checkbox in a list item,. Until now we have targeted class names, but this has just suffered a monumental amount of breaking changes.

Suggest adding non-changeable `data-test-{target-name}` to targetable internals.

### Use Case

`cy.get('mat-option:not(.mdc-list-item--selected)')`

see: https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices#Selecting-Elements
